definition: Pan Jinlian (name lit. Golden Lotus), heroine of Ming dynasty vernacular novel Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
lotus

sentences.english: On contemporary literature, Absurd Plays "Pan Jinlian" is a must-read works.
sentences.chinese: 上当代文学，荒诞剧《潘金莲》是必读作品。

sentences.english: The Sichuan opera Pan Jinlian examines Pan Jinli an's degradation from different perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 川剧《潘金莲》从不同视角中审视潘金莲的沉沦。

sentences.english: The Sichuan opera Pan Jinlian examines Pan Jinli an's degradation from different perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 川剧《潘金莲》从不同视角中审视潘金莲的沉沦。

sentences.english: The same stage, there is inter-generational cross-border inter-Korean intercontinental people to note Pan Jinlian.
sentences.chinese: 同一舞台上，有跨朝跨代跨国跨洲的人来评说潘金莲。

sentences.english: Pan Jinlian is a controversial literary heroine.
sentences.chinese: 潘金莲是一个有争议的女性形象。

sentences.english: Pan Jinlian is one of the most well-known typical images in Chinese Literature.
sentences.chinese: 潘金莲是中国知名度最高的典型形象之一。

definition: Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Wu Song, a heroic outlaw of Liangshan po 梁山泊 in the classic novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传, whose exploits including killing a tiger with his bare hands
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
Lin Chong, one of the Heroes of the Marsh in Water Margin
loose woman/prostitute/Jezebel
Jia Baoyu, male character in The Dream of Red Mansions, in love with his cousin Lin Daiyu 林黛玉 but obliged to marry Xue Baochai 薛寶釵|薛宝钗
Xue Baochai, female character in Dream of Red Mansions, married to Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
edge of the water/shore or sea, lake or river/seashore
Song Jiang, a principal hero of the novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传
Li Kui, character in the novel Water Margin 水滸全傳|水浒全传[Shui3 hu3 quan2 zhuan4]
(of a woman) to take a lover
Lin Daiyu, female character in The Dream of Red Mansions, cousin and thwarted lover of Jia Baoyu 賈寶玉|贾宝玉
Wang Ying (character in the "Water Margin")
(of a woman) to take a lover

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
